meanings.definition: The quality of being extremely poisonous or harmful.
meanings.sent1: The virulency of the venomous snake's bite quickly affected the victim.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the virulency of the new chemical compound.
meanings.sent3: The virulency of the spicy chili made everyone reach for a glass of water.
meanings.sent4: The virulency of the gossip spread through the office like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The virulency of the storm's winds caused widespread damage.

meanings.definition: The ability of a pathogen to cause disease.
meanings.sent1: Doctors were concerned about the virulency of the virus spreading in the community.
meanings.sent2: Researchers studied the virulency of different strains of bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The virulency of the flu virus made everyone in the household sick.
meanings.sent4: The virulency of the infection quickly overwhelmed the patient's immune system.
meanings.sent5: The virulency of the outbreak led to a quarantine of the affected area.

meanings.definition: The intensity of a negative emotion or feeling.
meanings.sent1: The virulency of her anger was evident in her raised voice.
meanings.sent2: The movie portrayed the virulency of grief after a loss.
meanings.sent3: The virulency of his jealousy towards his friend was comically exaggerated.
meanings.sent4: The virulency of the betrayal felt like a stab in the heart.
meanings.sent5: The virulency of the fear paralyzed him in place.
